Get FPI historical rating data (most recent of each year) Adapted from sabinanalytic's fork of the cfbscrapR repo (https://github.com/sabinanalytics/cfbscrapR/blob/master/R/cfb_ratings_fpi.R)

cfb_ratings_fpi.Rd

Get FPI historical rating data (most recent of each year) Adapted from sabinanalytic's fork of the cfbscrapR repo (https://github.com/sabinanalytics/cfbscrapR/blob/master/R/cfb_ratings_fpi.R)

cfb_ratings_fpi(year = 2019)

Arguments

year

Year

Examples


cfb_ratings_fpi(year=2018)
#> Scraping FPI totals for 2018!
#> # A tibble: 130 x 20
#>     year id    name  abbr  row_n fpi   fpi_rk trend proj_w proj_l win_out win_6
#>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  2018 228   Clem~ CLEM      1 32.7  1      1.0   15.0   0.0          0     1
#>  2  2018 333   Alab~ ALA       2 30.1  2      -1.0  14.0   1.0          0     1
#>  3  2018 61    Geor~ UGA       3 24.9  3      0.0   11.0   3.0          0     1
#>  4  2018 194   Ohio~ OSU       4 21.6  4      1.0   13.0   1.0          0     1
#>  5  2018 201   Okla~ OKLA      5 21.3  5      1.0   12.0   2.0          0     1
#>  6  2018 130   Mich~ MICH      6 20.1  6      -2.0  10.0   3.0          0     1
#>  7  2018 87    Notr~ ND        7 19.3  7      0.0   12.0   1.0          0     1
#>  8  2018 213   Penn~ PSU       8 18.5  8      0.0   9.0    4.0          0     1
#>  9  2018 344   Miss~ MSST      9 18.4  9      0.0   8.0    5.0          0     1
#> 10  2018 264   Wash~ WASH     10 17.3  10     0.0   10.0   4.0          0     1
#> # ... with 120 more rows, and 8 more variables: win_div <dbl>, playoff <dbl>,
#> #   nc_game <dbl>, nc_win <dbl>, win_conf <dbl>, w <chr>, l <chr>, t <chr>
